reference.name: Plant Names Simplified; Their Pronunciation Derivation & Meaning by Johnson and Smith
A Popular Dictionary of Botanical Names and Terms by G.F. Zimmer 1912

genus.name: Abelia
genus.meaning: after Dr Charles Able, physician and author on China who discovered A. chinensis (1)

genus.name: Abies
genus.meaning: ancient L. name, possibly from L. abeo depart, i.e. from the ground, referring to the great height attained by some species.(1)

species.name: nordmanniana
species.meaning: named after the Finnish zoologist Alexander von Nordmann (1803â€“1866)(3)

species.name: balsamea
species.meaning: having the soothing quality of balm (2)

species.name: pinsapo
species.meaning: possibly from Spanish pino meaning pine and sapo meaning fir being a fir in the pine family

genus.name: Acer
genus.meaning: Classical L. name, possibly from L. acer, hard or sharp, the wood once having been used for writing tablets.(1)

species.name: negundo
species.meaning: from the Sanskrit and Bengali word nirgundi, which was used as negundo in the naming of Vitex negundo and later for Acer negundo that has a leaf similar to that of Vitex negundo.

species.name: capillipes
species.meaning: from L. slender-footed (capillus meaning hair and pes meaning foot) in apparent reference to the thin flower/fruit stalks.

species.name: griseum
species.meaning: from L. griseus meaning gray in reference to color of the leaf undersides.

species.name: saccharum
species.meaning: means sugary in reference to the sweet sap. Saccharum is the genus name for sugarcane.

species.name: pensylvanicum
species.meaning: although misspelled by Linnaeus, the specific epithet is in fact a reference to the State of Pennsylvania where this tree is native.

species.name: pavia
species.meaning: honours 17th C. Dutch botanist Peter Paaw (Petrus Pavius)

genus.name: Aesculus
genus.meaning: ancient L. name of an oak or mast-bearing tree

species.name: hippocastanum
species.meaning: Gr. hippo, a horse and L. castanea, the Chestnut tree of Virgil

species.name: flava
species.meaning: L yellow refering to the flowers

species.name: indica
species.meaning: of India but has been applied to plants from East Indies as well as into China

genus.name: Ailanthus
genus.meaning: from the native Moluccan name, ailanto signifying tall enough to reach the sky

genus.name: Alnus
genus.meaning: L. name for alder

sub.name: Laciniata
sub.meaning: fringed, cut into deep,narrow irregular lobes

genus.name: Amelanchier
genus.meaning: adapted from Fr. amelancier, an old name in Savoy for A. vulgaris (or A. ovalis)

species.name: lamarckii
species.meaning: honors Jean Baptiste Antoine Monet de Lamarck, 18th century French naturalist, known for his theory of acquired characteristics

genus.name: Arbutus
genus.meaning: L. name, for A.unedo, perhaps derived from Celtic arboise, rough-fruited

species.name: unedo
species.meaning: Pliny derives name from unus, one and edo to eat i.e. to eat only one since taste is exceedingly bland

genus.name: Araucaria
genus.meaning: from araucanos name of of the Indian tribe of the Province of Araneo, Chile where A. araucana was first found

species.name: araucana
species.meaning: from the the Indian tribe name (renamed from imbricata)

genus.name: Azara
genus.meaning: after Spanish naturalist Felix de Azara (1742-1821) who spent time in South America in the late 1700s doing research

genus.name: Betula
genus.meaning: The Latin name for birch - Anglo-Saxon birce

species.name: ermanii
species.meaning: after the German amateur-botanist Georg Adolf Erman presumably found in his early travels before he became a distinguished physicist contributing to the theory of magnetism.

species.name: papyrifera
species.meaning: paper-bearing , in reference to the bark

genus.name: Buxus
genus.meaning: Ancient L. name for box

genus.name: Buddleja
genus.meaning: named by Linnaeus after Rev. Adam Buddle,one-time vicar of Farnbridge,Essex

species.name: davidii
species.meaning: after the Basque missionary and explorer in China, Father Armand David, who first noticed the shrub.

genus.name: Calycanthus
genus.meaning: from Gr. kalyx, a flower-cup (calyx) and anthos a flower, in reference to the coloured sepels

genus.name: Calocedrus
genus.meaning: Gr. kalos, beautiful and kedrus, Cedar

species.name: decurrens
species.meaning: decurrensis L. with leaf margins running gradually into the stems

genus.name: Carpinus
genus.meaning: ancient L. name for hornbeam

species.name: betulus
species.meaning: generic name for Birch which it resembles

genus.name: Carya
genus.meaning: from the Gr. karya used for walnut trees

genus.name: Castanea
genus.meaning: from Gr kastanun, a chestnut, said to be after Kastana, a district in Thessaly

genus.name: Catalpa
genus.meaning: corruption of 'Catawba', the name of the North American Indian tribe that formerly ocupied Georgia and the Carolinas

genus.name: Cedrus
genus.meaning: from Gr. Kedros, the Cedar of Pliny. alluding to the fragrance

genus.name: Celtis
genus.meaning: L. Pliny applied to an urelated species

genus.name: Cephalotaxus
genus.meaning: form Gr. kephale, head and Taxus, yew for its resemblance

species.name: fortunei
species.meaning: honours Robert Fortune (1812-1880), Scottish botanist and plant collector who introduced this palnt to Britain in 1848

genus.name: Cercidiphyllum
genus.meaning: from Gr. kerkis meaning redbud or Judas teeee, and pyllon, a leaf for its similarity to redbud

genus.name: Cercis
genus.meaning: an ancient name given to the Judas Tree by the Greek philosopher Theophrastus.

species.name: siliquastrum
species.meaning: from siliqua, a botantic name for pods having a partition between the seeds

genus.name: Chamaecyparis
genus.meaning: from Gr. chamai, dwarf or to the ground and kyparissos, cypress tree

species.name: lawsoniana
species.meaning: after Lawson amd Son nursery in Edinburgh who intoduced the tree into cultivation in 1854

species.name: obtusa
species.meaning: rounded, in reference to leaves being blunt/rounded at tips

genus.name: Chimonanthus
genus.meaning: from Gr. cheimon, winter and anthos, a flower , alluding the the flowering of C. fragrans in the winter

species.name: praecox
species.meaning: very early, in reference to bloom time

genus.name: Clerodendrum
genus.meaning: said to be from Gr kleros, chance and dendron, a tree -of uncertain significance

genus.name: Cordyline
genus.meaning: from Gr. kordyle meaning club

genus.name: Cornus
genus.meaning: from the L. a horn, from the hard nature of the wood

species.name: controversa
species.meaning: controversial, after the debate about its naming ?

species.name: kousa
species.meaning: from the Japanese name for the species

species.name: sanguinea
species.meaning: from L. sanguineus, blood in reference to the red autumn foliage and reddish twigs

genus.name: Corylus
genus.meaning: possible from Gr. korys a hood or helmet ie. the calyx covering the nut, or from Gr. karyon a hazel nut

species.name: avellana
species.meaning: after Avella, a town in Campania where the hazel nut is largely grown for its nuts

genus.name: Cotoneaster
genus.meaning: from old L. name cotoneus, a quince and aster, probably a corruption of as instar meaning a likeness i.e. Quince-like

genus.name: Crataegus
genus.meaning: Gr. krataigos, believed to be derived from kratos, strength, alluding to the hardness of the wood

species.name: crus-galli
species.meaning: L. leg of a cock in reference to the thorn's resemblance to a cock's spurs

genus.name: Cryptomeria
genus.meaning: from Gr. kryptos, hidden and meros a part, alluding to latent characteristics

genus.name: Cupressus
genus.meaning: classical name, said to be from Gr. kuo, to produce, parisos, equal, alluding to the symmetrical form of the Italian Cypress

genus.name: Cydonia
genus.meaning: from the town of Cydon (now Khania) in Crete

genus.name: Davidia
genus.meaning: after Armand David, French missionary who botanised in China

species.name: involucrata
species.meaning: involucred i.e. having an involucre as umbrels,heads

genus.name: Decaisnea
genus.meaning: honours Joseph Decaisne (1807-1882), director of the Jardin des Plantes, Paris

species.name: fargesii
species.meaning: honours Pere Guillaume Farges (1844-1912) who lived in China and discovered this plant

genus.name: Deutzia
genus.meaning: honours Johan van der Deutz (1743-1788) an amateur botanist form amsterdam (3)

species.name: scabra
species.meaning: rough in reference to rough,hairy leaves (3)

genus.name: Dicksonia
genus.meaning: honors James Dickson (1738-1822), British botanist and nurseryman(3)

species.name: antarctica
species.meaning: presumably refers to the southern hemisphere

genus.name: Drimys
genus.meaning: from Gr. drimus, acid, referrng to the pungent tast of bark and foliage

species.name: winteri
species.meaning: after a Captain Winter, one of Drake's captains who introduced the bark

genus.name: Elaeagnus
genus.meaning: comes from the Greek words elaia meaning the olive tree and agnos meaning chaste-tree.(3)

species.name: pungens
species.meaning: sharp-pointed in reference to the sharp thorny spines

genus.name: Eucalyptus
genus.meaning: Gr. eu, good or well and calypha, covered in allusion to the calyx which covers the flower like a lid

genus.name: Euonymus
genus.meaning: siadto benamed after Euonyme,the mother of the Furies or from Gr eu, good, onoma, a name ie of good repute

genus.name: Fagus
genus.meaning: the L. name for a Beech tree, some authorities deriving the word from Gr. phago to eat, the seeds being edible

genus.name: Ficus
genus.meaning: the L. name for a Fig tree and one common in many European languages. Believed to be derived from the Hebrew name fag

genus.name: Fraxinus
genus.meaning: L. name for an Ash tree, probably from Gr. phrasso, to fence, the wood being useful for fence-making

genus.name: Garrya
genus.meaning: named by Douglas in hour of Mr. Garry of the Hudson Bay Company who helped Douglas with his plant-collecting

genus.name: Genista
genus.meaning: ancient L. name

genus.name: Ginkgo
genus.meaning: is a misrendering of the Japanese gin meaning silver and kyo meaning apricot used in Japan in the 17th century

genus.name: Gleditsia
genus.meaning: named after Johann Gottlieb Gleditsch (1714-1786), director of the Botanical Garden, Berlin.

species.name: triacanthos
species.meaning: from Gr. tri, three and Gr. acantha, thorn

genus.name: Griselinia
genus.meaning: after Franc Griselini, a Venetian botanist

genus.name: Gymnocladus
genus.meaning: from Gr. gymnos, naked and klados, a branch, presumably in allusion to the buds being almost invisible on the winter branches

species.name: dioicus
species.meaning: meaning dioecious, having separate male and female plants

genus.name: Hippophae
genus.meaning: Gr name for a spring plant

genus.name: Idesia
genus.meaning: after E. Y. Ides, a Dutchman who travelled to China in the 17th C.

genus.name: Jasminum
genus.meaning: said to be derived from ysmyn, the Arabic name

species.name: beesianum
species.meaning: after Messrs. Bees, the nurserymen who introduced the plant

genus.name: Ilex
genus.meaning: from the old l. name ilex, an evergreen oak, to which the Holly is supposed to bear some resemblance

genus.name: Juniperus
genus.meaning: old L. name

genus.name: Juglans
genus.meaning: old L. name for the walnut tree, possibly from Jovis glans, the nut of Jupiter in mythology

genus.name: Koelreuteria
genus.meaning: after Joseph Gottlieb KÃ¶lreuter, a German botanist

species.name: paniculata
species.meaning: flowers in panticles, a much-branched inflorescence

genus.name: Laburnum
genus.meaning: old L. name

species.name: anagyroides
species.meaning: resembling the genus Anagyris, almost extinct flowering plants

genus.name: Larix
genus.meaning: old L. name for the Larch

genus.name: Laurus
genus.meaning: Old L. name for a Bay tree, the true 'Laurel' of the ancients, perhaps derived from Celtic laur, green

genus.name: Ligustrum
genus.meaning: L. name for privet, possibly from L. ligo to bind, the twigs having been used for tying

genus.name: Liquidambar
genus.meaning: from L. liquidus, liquid and ambar, Arabic amber from the fragrant resin

genus.name: Liriodendron
genus.meaning: from Gr. lirion, a lily and dendron, a tree

genus.name: Magnolia
genus.meaning: >named by Linneaus in commemoration of Piere Magnol, a professor of botant and medicine at Montpellier in 16th C

cross.name: soulangeana
cross.meaning: honors Chevalier Etienne Soulange-Bodin (1774-1846), Director of the French Royal Institute.

genus.name: Malus
genus.meaning: from Gr malon, apple

genus.name: Mespilus
genus.meaning: from Gr. mesos, half and pilos a ball, refering to the shape of the fruits

genus.name: Morus
genus.meaning: ancient L. name for mulberry

genus.name: Olearia
genus.meaning: believed to refer to resemblance to Olea (Olive)

genus.name: Ostrya
genus.meaning: possibly from Gr. ostryos a scale in allusion to the scaly catkins

genus.name: Parrotia
genus.meaning: after the German botanist Friedrich Parrot

genus.name: Paulownia
genus.meaning: named by a Dutch botanist named Siebold after Anna Paulowna, daughter of Tsar Paul I of Russia and queen consort of King William II of the Netherlands

genus.name: Phillyrea
genus.meaning: from Gr. philein, to love, in reference to to the lily-like flowers

genus.name: Picea
genus.meaning: ancient L. name for Spruce, perhaps derived from the L. pix meaning pitch

species.name: breweriana
species.meaning: after William Henry Brewer (1828-1910), professor of agriculture at Yale University

genus.name: Pittosporum
genus.meaning: from Gr. pitte, tar and sporos, seed the latter being coated with a resinous substance

genus.name: Platanus
genus.meaning: the old Gr. name for the Plane tree, from platus in reference to the palmate leaves or the broad spread of the tree

genus.name: Pinus
genus.meaning: ancient classical name for a pine tree

species.name: pinaster
species.meaning: old name for the Maritime Pine

species.name: wallichiana
species.meaning: after Nathaniel Wallich (1786-1854), Danish botanist and superintendent of the Calcutta Botantic Garden

genus.name: Populus
genus.meaning: the arbor-populus, the tree of the people of the Romans, the Italian Popular being much planted in their cities.

species.name: deltoides
species.meaning: triangular or deltoid shape of the leaves

species.name: tremula
species.meaning: trembling, the quivering of the leaves

genus.name: Prunus
genus.meaning: classical name for the Plum

species.name: sargentii
species.meaning: named after Charles S. Sargent (1841-1927) first director of the Arnold Arboretum

genus.name: Pseudotsuga
genus.meaning: false Tsuga, the genus of the Hemlock firs

species.name: menziesii
species.meaning: after Archibald Menzies, a Scottish physician and naturalist

genus.name: Pterocarya
genus.meaning: ptero, winged and carya, hickory

genus.name: Punica
genus.meaning: from Malus punica Apple of Carthage, an early name for the Pomogranate

genus.name: Pyracantha
genus.meaning: from Gr. pyros, fire and akanthos, a thorn, in reference to brilliant berries and spiny branches

genus.name: Pyrus
genus.meaning: classical name for a Pear tree

genus.name: Quercus
genus.meaning: Latin name for an oak tree; some authorities derive word form Celtic quer, fine and cuez, a tree

species.name: alba
species.meaning: L. white refers to the light ash-grey bark

species.name: cerris
species.meaning: The old L. name for the Turkey Oak

species.name: coccinea
species.meaning: L. Scarlet, refering to the autumnal colour of the leaves

species.name: ilex
species.meaning: ancient L. name for the Holm Oak, now generic name for the hollies which some evergreen oaks resemble

species.name: robur
species.meaning: L. robust referring to its strength and durability

species.name: rubra
species.meaning: L. red after the autumnal leaves

species.name: suber
species.meaning: cork - old L. name for the Cork Oak

species.name: coccifera
species.meaning: L coccus, from the Greek of the Kermes insect and L fera, bearer, alluding to the kermes insect parasitic on this tree, and which yields a crimson dye

genus.name: Rhamnus
genus.meaning: ancient Gr. name, possibly from rhamnos, a thorny shrub

species.name: frangula
species.meaning: brittle - old name for this buckthorn

genus.name: Rhus
genus.meaning: ancient Gr. name

genus.name: Robinia
genus.meaning: named after Jean Robin, a French botanist and herbalist to Henry IV of France

genus.name: Salix
genus.meaning: L. name for willow, possibly form celtic sal, near and lis, water

genus.name: Sambucus
genus.meaning: ancient L. name for Elder

species.name: platyphyllos
species.meaning: Gr. playts, broad and phyllon, leaf in reference to the large leaves.

genus.name: Sequoia
genus.meaning: after Sequoyah (1767-1843), the inventor of the Cherokee alphabet

genus.name: Sequoiadendron
genus.meaning: Sequioa leaved

genus.name: Sophora
genus.meaning: from an Arabic nae for a tree with pea-shaped flowers

genus.name: Sorbus
genus.meaning: from L. service tree

species.name: hupehensis
species.meaning: from Hupeh a province of China

species.name: aucuparia
species.meaning: from L avis, bird and capere, catching in reference to the use of the fruit of S. aucuparia as bait for fowling.

species.name: torminalis
species.meaning: from the l. tormina, meaning gripe in reference to the use of the fruits as a herbal treatment for colic

genus.name: Syringa
genus.meaning: from Gr.syrinx, a tube said to be in allusion to the hollow stems used for pipes

species.name: daniellii
species.meaning: name honours William Freeman Daniell(1818-1865), British army surgeon and botanist

genus.name: Taxus
genus.meaning: L. name for yew perhaps from taxon a bow,the wood having once been used in their making

genus.name: Thuja
genus.meaning: classical name, possibly from Gr. thuia, ancient name for some resin-bearing tree, or from Gr, thuon, a sacrifice at which the resin would be burnt

genus.name: Thujopsis
genus.meaning: from Gr. thuja and opsis, likeness

genus.name: Tilia
genus.meaning: old L. name for Lime tree

genus.name: Trachycarpus
genus.meaning: from Gr trachus,rough and karpus, a fruit

genus.name: Tsuga
genus.meaning: Japanese name for T. seiboldii

genus.name: Ulmus
genus.meaning: old L. name for Elm, perhaps from the Celtic name ulm

species.name: glabra
species.meaning: L. smooth, in probable reference to the bark

genus.name: Viburnum
genus.meaning: old L. name for V. lantana

species.name: lantana
species.meaning: ancient name for the Wayfaring Tree

species.name: opulus
species.meaning: once the generic name for the Guelder Rose

genus.name: Wisteria
genus.meaning: after Casper Wistar (1761 - 1818), professor at University of Pennsylania

genus.name: Wollemia
genus.meaning: after the Wollemi National Park where Wollemia nobilis was discovered.

species.name: nobilis
species.meaning: after David Noble, the park ranger and explorer who discovered the species in 1994

genus.name: Zanthoxylum
genus.meaning: from Gr. xanthos,yellow, and xolum, wood

genus.name: Zelkova
genus.meaning: from the vernacular name in the Caucasus

genus.name: Acacia
genus.meaning: Gr akazo to sharpen or Gr akakia the Egyptian Thorn A. arabica

species.name: cyanophylla
species.meaning: from GR cyanos dark blue and phyllon leaf

genus.name: Desfontainia
genus.meaning: named after the French botanist Rene Louiche Desfontaines

genus.name: Ehretia
genus.meaning: named in honour of the German botanical illustrator Georg Dionysius Ehret

genus.name: Myrtus
genus.meaning: L. name for Murtle

genus.name: Cistus
genus.meaning: Ancient Gr. name for the Rock Rose

genus.name: Diospyros
genus.meaning: Gr dios divine and pyros wheat or grain

genus.name: Tamarix
genus.meaning: from Tamaris (Tambro) a river in Spain

genus.name: Ricinus
genus.meaning: classical L. name possibly from ricinus, a tick or bug which the seed resembles

genus.name: Delonix
genus.meaning: from Gr delos, evident or conspicuous and onux a claw referring to the long-clawed petals

genus.name: Euphorbia
genus.meaning: after Euphorbus, physician to Juba, King of Mauritania
